_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:18:09 using v2.0
title: How have breaches of the four hour target changed each quarter?
analysis_commentary: The percentage of people waiting more than four hours for their treatment to be completed in A&E fell dramatically with the introduction of the target in January 2004 (Quarter 2003/04) and reaching the old 2% target in Quarter 2 2005/06. Over the next five years, the proportion of breaches was between 2 and 4%. The relaxation of the target to 5% in 2010 was associated with an increase in patients waiting more than four hours, but performance was initially still in line with the new target until Quarter 2 2012/13, when it began to increase. By Quarter 4 2012/13, this had risen to 9% - the highest level since the introduction of the four hour target.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
